description: Expresses an alternative or a condition. Used to present what will happen if a condition is not met, or to offer an alternative option.
usage: Commonly used to express consequences of not doing something, or to present an alternative. Can mean 'otherwise' or simply 'or' when offering choices.

examples.french: Dépêche-toi, sinon tu vas rater le train !
examples.english: Hurry up, otherwise you'll miss the train!

examples.french: Je préfère le thé, sinon je prendrai du café.
examples.english: I prefer tea, otherwise I'll have coffee.

examples.french: Prends un parapluie, sinon tu vas être trempé.
examples.english: Take an umbrella, or else you'll get soaked.

examples.french: Tu veux du vin rouge ou sinon du blanc ?
examples.english: Do you want red wine or white?

notes: Very common in everyday French. Essential for expressing conditions and alternatives in conversation.
